titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Augustus Sala Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 03:05

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The George Augustus Sala Collection consists of papers accumulated by Ralph Straus in writing his biography of Sala; and autograph manuscript correspondence and writings by Sala acquired from other sources. Papers of Straus consist of autograph letters, signed, to and from Sala, members of his family, and others; autograph manuscript writings and notes by Sala; clippings of articles by and about Sala; photographs, engraved portraits, and printed caricatures of Sala; and autograph manuscript notes and correspondence of Straus.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ralph Straus Papers Relating to George Augustus Sala: purchased from Pickering and Chatto on the Plain Fund, 1946.
Materials from Other Sources: acquired from various sources, 1937-2005. For more information, see the finding aid container list.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The George Augustus Sala Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: George Augustus Sala Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection consists of materials formerly classed as MS Vault Shelves Sala, Ms Vault Sala, Uncat MS Vault 801, and Uncat Ms Vault File. In 2013, the collection received a baseline level of processing, including partial rehousing and minimal organization. The collection was reclassed under one call number, materials were organized by acquisition, and containers were renumbered in a single sequence. Most folder titles and folder notes were adapted from card catalog descriptions; some were assigned by Library staff. Chronological arrangement within groups of correspondence was retained, and card catalog see references from names of correspondents were adapted as subseries notes. Some names of correspondents were updated to conform to Library of Congress name authorities. Folder titles were not verified against contents.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Sala, George Augustus. Contributions to periodicals (Ip Sa31 C1 and Ip Sa31 +C1).
Sala, George Augustus. Pamphlets by and about George Augustus Henry Sala (Ip Sa31 1).
Other books owned by Sala may be found in the online catalog by searching "Sala, George Augustus" as a special collections subject or "Ip Sa31" as a local call number.
Drawings owned by Sala were transferred to theYale University Art Gallery in 1953.

bioghist.head: George Augustus Sala (1828-1895)
bioghist.p: English journalist; contributed to the Daily Telegraph and other serials; and published collections of his articles. Sala was a son of singer and actress Henrietta Catherina Florentina Simon Sala (1789?-1860). He married Harriet Elizabeth Hollingsworth Sala (died 1885) in 1859, and he married Bessie Stannard Sala in 1890.

bioghist.head: Ralph Straus (1882-1950)
bioghist.p: English author and journalist. Author of Sala: the Portrait of an Eminent Victorian (London: Constable, [1942]).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The George Augustus Sala Collection consists of papers accumulated by Ralph Straus in writing his biography of Sala; and autograph manuscript correspondence and writings by Sala acquired by the Library from other sources. Papers of Straus consist of autograph letters, signed, to and from Sala, members of his family, and others; autograph manuscript writings and notes by Sala; clippings of articles by and about Sala; photographs, engraved portraits, and printed caricatures of Sala; and autograph manuscript notes and correspondence of Straus.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Ralph Straus Papers Relating to George Augustus Sala, 1828-1942. II. Materials from Other Sources, 1855-1899.

did.unittitle: Ralph Straus Papers Relating to George Augustus Sala

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four subseries: Correspondence, arranged by names of Sala and his family, and subarranged chronologically within each name; Writings by George Augustus Sala, arranged alphabetically by work title; Other Papers of George Augustus Sala, arranged alphabetically by folder title; and Other Papers of Ralph Straus, arranged alphabetically by folder title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence consists of autograph letters, signed, from and to George Augustus Sala; Harriet Elizabeth Hollingsworth Sala; and Bessie Stannard Sala; and to Henrietta Catherina Florentina Simon Sala. Also present are typed transcripts of letters from George Augustus Sala, and third-party autograph letters, signed, concerning Sala. Writings of George Augustus Sala contains autograph manuscript drafts and clippings of articles and stories; autograph manuscript notes and fragments; and a disbound copy of Sala's autobiography, The Life and Adventures of George Augustus Sala (London: Cassell, 1895). Other Papers of George Augustus Sala contain additional writings fragments, family papers, and ephemera. Other Papers of Ralph Straus contains autograph manuscript notes, correspondence, and research materials. Original folders have been retained; additional fragments of notes by Straus, apparently concerning Sala, are affixed to some.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes typed and manuscript bibliographical notes, rubbings, title pages, and pieces of binding material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Incoming autograph letters, signed, to Straus, concerning his biography of Sala.
Includes:
Heal, Ambrose, 1931 December 12.
Hird, Frank, 1935 July 29.
Johnson, Charles Plumptre, 935 August 19.
Lucas, E. V. (Edward Verrall), 1933 January 23.
Mottram, R. H. (Ralph Hale), 1933. Accompanied by letter from Fred Sidney Davis to R. H. Mottram, 1933 August 10.
Richardson, Joseph Hall, 1934 January 9.
Wright, Thomas, 1935 December 7.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: List of Sala's publications, illustrations, theatrical productions, periodical contributions and public addresses. Contains a chronological listing of Sala's works published in periodicals, and an index to these periodicals.

did.unittitle: The homes of Sala. Clippings and prints
The library of George Augustus Sala. Typescript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: List of books owned by George Augustus Sala, in order of acquisition, with transcriptions of inscriptions and other notes by Sala.
With 2 letters and 2 postcards from booksellers to Straus about books owned by Sala.

scopecontent.p: Daily listing of writings and activities of Sala

unittitle.title: Sala: the Portrait of an Eminent Victorian

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fragment, autograph manuscript, pages 257-259.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings of pictures of Sala and contemporary people and places; articles by Sala; fragments of proofs for Straus's Sala: the Portrait of an Eminent Victorian ; and manuscript notes by Straus.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Correspondence, arranged alphabetically by name; and Other Papers, arranged alphabetically by folder title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence consists of autograph letters, signed, from Sala, with a few third-party letters from J. Hain Friswell. Other Papers contains writings and notes by Sala, most autograph manuscript.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Outgoing autograph letters, signed, from Sala, unless otherwise noted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains letters from Sala to:
Gallenga, Antonio Carlo Napoleone, 1871 February 20.
Mayhew, Augustus, 1872 July 1.
Mellison, John, 1876 July 10.
"Bethune, Mr.," 1879 July 7.
Lupton, I. T., 1882 July 13.
Downing, William, 1883 January 25.
Bromhead, V. G., appended to an unidentified fragment, autograph manuscript, 1883 December 8.
Skirrow, Charles, Mrs., with drawing, pen-and-ink and watercolor, 1884 April 19.
Hallett, Hughes, 1884 October 19 and 1887 March 7.
Cole, Henry, Hotel, undated.
Dusser, Christopher, undated.
Accompanied by clippings.
